Articles.Content:
I'm new to KSP, and I've launched several unnamed ships, having them crash before they hit atmosphere.

They now lie around Kerbin, and it's ****ing me off, seeing all these Unnamed ships lying around, and taking up space in the tracking center.

I'm making a ballistic rocket to blow them up, but it takes too long. Any way to get rid of them easier?

Edited September 11, 2012 by sal_vager
Edited Profanity

Hi Gamerboy4life, you can remove all debris by moving the debris slider in the settings screen to zero, then starting a flight, this will delete all debris.

If you want to get rid of everything you can delete your persistence file in KSP_win\saves\default
Is it the reddish ship markers that are lying around, or the white debris markers? If the capsule survives a crash, you need to "end flight" it or the reddish marker will stay there forever.
